decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun within 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To prevent the accumulation of unimplemented planning permissions and to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and to meet the requirements of Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 and to meet the requirements of The Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015.
Condition : 2 - The development shall be carried out in accordance with the reports, specifications and drawings detailed B197411-3100 - 01 rev B, B197411-3000 - 01 rev C, B197411-3101 - 01 rev A, Location Plan provided, Fire Safety Statement dated September 2023. 
Reason: To ensure a satisfactory standard of development and to allow the local planning authority to review any potential changes to the scheme. 
Condition : 3 - The roof area of the development hereby permitted shall not be used as a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area and furthermore, no balustrades, railings or other means of enclosure or means of permanent access shall be erected on this area.
Reason: To control overlooking and safeguard the privacy of neighbours in accordance with Council policy LP2 of the Local Plan coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework.
Condition : 4 - The proposed development shall be carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice under BS5837:2012. Should any tree roots of greater than 20mm diameter be encountered during construction works of the extension hereby approved then professional arboricultural advice should be sought. A directory of arboricultural specialists approved by the Arboricultural Association, with the relevant training, insurance and certification is available at: http://www.trees.org.uk or ring the Association on 01242 522152.
Reason: To preserve trees and hedges on the neighbouring site in the interests of visual amenity and the character of the area, in accordance with Council policy LP56 of the Wandsworth Local Plan (2023) coupled with the requirements of the National Planning Policy Framework 2023.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE: In dealing with this application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive manner and the Council has, as far as practicable, sought solutions to problems arising in relation to dealing with the planning application. The Council has made available detailed advice in the form of its statutory policies in the Local Plan (2023), Supplementary Planning Documents and where appropriate the Site Specific Allocations Document as well as offering a full pre-application advice service, in order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition, where appropriate, further guidance was offered to the applicant during the processing of the application.
description: Proposed ground floor rear extension, driveway alteration, floor plan redesign and all associated works at 72a Balham Park Road, SW12 8EA
